revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-04-11 20:51:25.000000000', 'files': ['docker/base/Dockerfile.j2', 'docker/base/kolla_bashrc', 'ansible/library/kolla_docker.py'], 'message': 'Identify container through  PS1 shell variable

As suggested it was created the variable KOLLA_SERVICE_NAME to identify
the container service name through  PS1 shell variable.
This method it was previously discussed in IRC.
https://goo.gl/k7AdEg

The other option it was usage hostname param in kolla_docker, but
currently docker does not support it due this issue:
https://github.com/docker/compose/issues/2460

The final result is like this:

$ docker exec -it heka /bin/bash
(heka)[heka@kolla-control /]$

$ docker exec -it mariadb /bin/bash
(mariadb)[mysql@kolla-control /]$

More details can be accessed through this link
http://paste.openstack.org/show/493689/

Closes-Bug: #1557454
Change-Id: I6aab8d640a8ebb17baa9d6d4f1edd6e331674713
'}]
commit_message:
Identify container through  PS1 shell variable

As suggested it was created the variable KOLLA_SERVICE_NAME to identify
the container service name through  PS1 shell variable.
This method it was previously discussed in IRC.
https://goo.gl/k7AdEg

The other option it was usage hostname param in kolla_docker, but
currently docker does not support it due this issue:
https://github.com/docker/compose/issues/2460

The final result is like this:

$ docker exec -it heka /bin/bash
(heka)[heka@kolla-control /]$

$ docker exec -it mariadb /bin/bash
(mariadb)[mysql@kolla-control /]$

More details can be accessed through this link
http://paste.openstack.org/show/493689/

Closes-Bug: #1557454
Change-Id: I6aab8d640a8ebb17baa9d6d4f1edd6e331674713

commit_message:
Port swob to Python 3

This patch has no effect on Python 2, it only fix bytes vs Unicode
issues on Python 3.

Changes:

* Use bytes for HTTP body
* HeaderEnvironProxy: on Python 3, decode HTTP header values from
  Latin1.
* On Python 3, don't encode HTTP headers when it's not needed.
* On Python 3, encode content type and boundary to UTF-8, and decode
  the boundary from UTF-8 in test_utils.
* tox.ini: add test_swob.py to Python 3.4

Change-Id: Ie6c7bd363757f28a1dd88ffb2eae17bc47816c59

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-04-11 16:08:52.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py', 'swift/common/swob.py', 'swift/common/request_helpers.py', 'tox.ini', 'swift/common/header_key_dict.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': "Parse HTTP as bytes on Python 3

Various changes in swift.common.swob and swift.common.utils to parse
HTTP as bytes on Python 3.

This patch has no effect on Python 2, it only fix bytes vs Unicode
issues on Python 3.

With this change, test_utils now pass on Python 3.4.

Changes:

* HeaderKeyDict: On Python 3, decode bytes headers to Latin1. On
  Python 2, encode headers to UTF-8.
* Replace (int, long) with six.integer_types
* Request: on Python 3, don't encode path, urllib does it for us.
* get_policy_index(): on Python 3, decode the HTTP header from UTF-8.
* JSON: encode to/decode from UTF-8 on Python 3. On Python 3,
  json.dumps() returns a Unicode string, and json.loads() requires a
  Unicode string.
* document_iters_to_http_response_body(): on Python 3, decode content
  type and content range HTTP headers from Latin1
* Encode/Decode MIME boundary header to/from UTF-8
* test_utils: feed iter_multipart_mime_documents() with BytesIO(),
  not StringIO(), to get bytes on Python 3. HTTP body type is bytes.
* Fix also some other bytes/Unicode issues in test_utils

Change-Id: Id7a9317c795acf61a4d909a5b3039393ba901a79
"}]
commit_message:
Parse HTTP as bytes on Python 3

Various changes in swift.common.swob and swift.common.utils to parse
HTTP as bytes on Python 3.

This patch has no effect on Python 2, it only fix bytes vs Unicode
issues on Python 3.

With this change, test_utils now pass on Python 3.4.

Changes:

* HeaderKeyDict: On Python 3, decode bytes headers to Latin1. On
  Python 2, encode headers to UTF-8.
* Replace (int, long) with six.integer_types
* Request: on Python 3, don't encode path, urllib does it for us.
* get_policy_index(): on Python 3, decode the HTTP header from UTF-8.
* JSON: encode to/decode from UTF-8 on Python 3. On Python 3,
  json.dumps() returns a Unicode string, and json.loads() requires a
  Unicode string.
* document_iters_to_http_response_body(): on Python 3, decode content
  type and content range HTTP headers from Latin1
* Encode/Decode MIME boundary header to/from UTF-8
* test_utils: feed iter_multipart_mime_documents() with BytesIO(),
  not StringIO(), to get bytes on Python 3. HTTP body type is bytes.
* Fix also some other bytes/Unicode issues in test_utils

Change-Id: Id7a9317c795acf61a4d909a5b3039393ba901a79

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-02-12 20:24:50.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Port get_hmac() and hash_path() to Python 3

* HASH_PATH_PREFIX and HASH_PATH_SUFFIX of swift.common.utils are now
  byte strings. On Python 3, validate_hash_conf() decodes the
  configuration file from Latin1 and then encode back prefix/suffix
  to Latin1 to get the raw bytes unchanged.
* Parse the configuration file using RawConfigParser on Python 3 to
  not use interpolation like "var2 = %(var)s".
* get_hmac() now encodes request_method, path and expires to UTF-8.
  key must be a bytes string.
* Fix related unit tests

Change-Id: Ia2085b924957d2c41b2f19db087532e3f0f6cb03
'}]
commit_message:
Port get_hmac() and hash_path() to Python 3

* HASH_PATH_PREFIX and HASH_PATH_SUFFIX of swift.common.utils are now
  byte strings. On Python 3, validate_hash_conf() decodes the
  configuration file from Latin1 and then encode back prefix/suffix
  to Latin1 to get the raw bytes unchanged.
* Parse the configuration file using RawConfigParser on Python 3 to
  not use interpolation like "var2 = %(var)s".
* get_hmac() now encodes request_method, path and expires to UTF-8.
  key must be a bytes string.
* Fix related unit tests

Change-Id: Ia2085b924957d2c41b2f19db087532e3f0f6cb03

commit_message:
Split up BaseTestCase into two classes

one for pure unit testing without database, another for ordinary tests
with EnvironmentManager and database. Also do similar thing with
BaseValidatorTest. Execution without setting and deleting database for
every test is much faster.

This patch also fix some inheritance of test cases that are not use
database.

Change-Id: If477d478410937f424ade6f9ff2b8b12fc21c894

commit_message:

commit_message:
Process deployed environment configuration in UI

Deployed environment configuration is loaded once
environment page is opened.
If deployed configuration is loaded, then
Load Deployed buttons are shown on Networks and Settings tab.
UI code checks difference between deployed settings
and current environment configuration and displays
Discard button on Dashboard.

Closes-Bug: #1564953

Change-Id: Ibd11ad8cf709fbf0ce8d09729b7bcb5507081a5c
(cherry picked from commit 4fa15c3d999f4d3b4cbeb4bc4c3b4c6053a63e17)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-12 08:49:04.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/agent/agent_manager.py', 'tests-py3.txt', 'neutron_lbaas/services/loadbalancer/data_models.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/agent/test_agent_manager.py'], 'message': 'Port agent_manager to Python 3

* Use OrderedDict to get a deterministic order for instance_mapping.
  On Python 3, dictionary keys are iterated on a random order because
  of the randomized hash function.
* LbaasAgentManager.agent_updated(): replace dict.keys() with
  list(dict.keys()) since the loop body modifies the dict, and
  dict.keys() now returns a view on Python 3, no more a list.
* Data model: only encode text strings to UTF-8 on Python 2. Python 3
  loves Unicode!
* replace contextlib.nested() with tests.nested()
* tests-py3.txt: add tests.unit.agent.test_agent_manager

Change-Id: Ia3a461e4ae04b178a626885588d1d13cee8ca38f
'}]
commit_message:
Port agent_manager to Python 3

* Use OrderedDict to get a deterministic order for instance_mapping.
  On Python 3, dictionary keys are iterated on a random order because
  of the randomized hash function.
* LbaasAgentManager.agent_updated(): replace dict.keys() with
  list(dict.keys()) since the loop body modifies the dict, and
  dict.keys() now returns a view on Python 3, no more a list.
* Data model: only encode text strings to UTF-8 on Python 2. Python 3
  loves Unicode!
* replace contextlib.nested() with tests.nested()
* tests-py3.txt: add tests.unit.agent.test_agent_manager

Change-Id: Ia3a461e4ae04b178a626885588d1d13cee8ca38f

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-04-07 14:26:20.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_solidfire.py'], 'message': 'Update SolidFire driver to store cluster info

Currently we have the ability to send commands to unconfigured SolidFire
clusters using the endpoint argument in our api calls.  That's not bad
but it has lead to some cruft and confusing code where it becomes
difficult to determine "which" endpoint we actually want, and if we
were able to pass it through the sometimes long chain of commands.

This change is a move to simplify things a bit.  Rather than pass
and endpoint variable around, this introduces the strategy of
setting an "active_cluster" in the driver.  This way an operation
can adjust this as needed based on the call being issued.

This also let's us consolidate all of the cluster specific
parameters in to a single data structure which in and of
itself is worthwhile.

Change-Id: Icdfb8c2c0e760a255db9387bf9df28616f2497aa
'}]
commit_message:
Update SolidFire driver to store cluster info

Currently we have the ability to send commands to unconfigured SolidFire
clusters using the endpoint argument in our api calls.  That's not bad
but it has lead to some cruft and confusing code where it becomes
difficult to determine "which" endpoint we actually want, and if we
were able to pass it through the sometimes long chain of commands.

This change is a move to simplify things a bit.  Rather than pass
and endpoint variable around, this introduces the strategy of
setting an "active_cluster" in the driver.  This way an operation
can adjust this as needed based on the call being issued.

This also let's us consolidate all of the cluster specific
parameters in to a single data structure which in and of
itself is worthwhile.

Change-Id: Icdfb8c2c0e760a255db9387bf9df28616f2497aa

subject: Fix retrieving VHDX block size
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-12 16:37:35.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/utils/storage/virtdisk/vhdutils.py', 'os_win/tests/utils/storage/virtdisk/test_vhdutils.py', 'os_win/utils/storage/virtdisk/virtdisk_constants.py'], 'message': 'Fix retrieving VHDX block size

We need the VHDX block size when retrieving the maximum internal
size of a VHDX for a specific file size.

The issue is that we rely on the virtdisk.dll API to give us this
value, while for fixed size images, the block size will always be
reported as 0.

This can easily be avoided by reintroducing the method which actually
parses the image file in order to retrieve the VHDX block size.

Closes-Bug: #1569451
Change-Id: Id035dbc070566817a60eed8270e39c52d3b54821
'}]
commit_message:
Fix retrieving VHDX block size

We need the VHDX block size when retrieving the maximum internal
size of a VHDX for a specific file size.

The issue is that we rely on the virtdisk.dll API to give us this
value, while for fixed size images, the block size will always be
reported as 0.

This can easily be avoided by reintroducing the method which actually
parses the image file in order to retrieve the VHDX block size.

Closes-Bug: #1569451
Change-Id: Id035dbc070566817a60eed8270e39c52d3b54821

commit_message:
Get rid of httplib2, use urllib3 instead

httplib2 has been abandonned by its author [1] and is less going
to be updated and maintained than urllib3. So, let's replace httplib2
with urllib3.

Note that this patch mostly rework the unit tests.

I removed the files `tempest.tests.fake_identity` and
`tempest.tests.fake_http` to use their `tempest.tests.lib` counterpart.

Also, I tried to "encapsulated" HTTP calls and use
`tempest/lib/common/http.py` everywhere so that we only import
urllib3 once. This makes us not so dependent on a specific HTTP
library.

[1] http://bitworking.org/news/2016/03/an_update_on_httplib2
Change-Id: Id469e78afdb69a404144568a454d98d20a924231

commit_message:
Deprecate image list/show/delete/update CLIs/APIs

This deprecates all of the image CLIs/python API bindings that use
the Nova os-images API which is a proxy to the Glance v1 API.

This will emit a warning each time a deprecated CLI/API is used and also
updates the help docs for the deprecated CLIs and docstrings for APIs.

The plan is to do a release once this is merged so people start seeing
it and then we'll actually remove the deprecated CLIs/APIs in the first
python-novaclient release after the Nova server 15.0.0 'O' release.

Depends-On: Iff5fb3180855de7adb3399f6be16bedc8543b4ec

commit_message:
Fix logic on skipping collections

The old logic was in the check method so it would collect the first
url and then skip the rest. Move the logic to check the time to
prepare_run() so it only gets checked once per collection cycle

Change-Id: Ic39c52dbacaa9bed5d1e5e69856038c20f1d8bb4
Closes-Bug: #1569615

commit_message:
Append existing information during subnet set

Existing values of --dns-nameserver, --allocation-pool and --houst-routes
is currently overwritten when a user executes 'port set', but
actually that data should be appended.
This patch fixes the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1564447
Change-Id: I3dba9afa68d869abb3960b55a6880401a10eebf7

subject: Update the config_template plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-13 15:05:15.000000000', 'files': ['action/_v1_config_template.py', 'action/_v2_config_template.py'], 'message': "Update the config_template plugin

These changes address 2 issues:

* The config template plugin in v1 mode was not respecting a list
  of integers and would cause a stacktrace because the ConfigParse
  module expects everything written to be a string.
* The config template plugin in v2 mode was not properly handling
  the multi-string-op type due to an oversight in the ``_option_write``
  method.

With these updates the config template is now able to better support
all of the potential options that could be thrown at it when writing
an INI config file.

These issues we're discovered while working with the ceph-ansible
project and a mirroring PR has been created here:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/pull/707

Change-Id: I051096abae883ac81195d4538140566b69f8996c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit cd47eda77b2a5ec37c82faacde6a9241f8d2a5c4)
"}]
commit_message:
Update the config_template plugin

These changes address 2 issues:

* The config template plugin in v1 mode was not respecting a list
  of integers and would cause a stacktrace because the ConfigParse
  module expects everything written to be a string.
* The config template plugin in v2 mode was not properly handling
  the multi-string-op type due to an oversight in the ``_option_write``
  method.

With these updates the config template is now able to better support
all of the potential options that could be thrown at it when writing
an INI config file.

These issues we're discovered while working with the ceph-ansible
project and a mirroring PR has been created here:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/pull/707

Change-Id: I051096abae883ac81195d4538140566b69f8996c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit cd47eda77b2a5ec37c82faacde6a9241f8d2a5c4)

subject: Use ansible facts for distributing SSL certs/keys
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-11 21:04:18.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/keystone_ssl_key_store.yml', 'tasks/keystone_ssl_key_create.yml', 'tests/test-keystone-functional.yml', 'tasks/keystone_ssl_key_distribute.yml', 'tests/test-vars.yml'], 'message': "Use ansible facts for distributing SSL certs/keys

The os_keystone role previously relied on a memcached deployment to transfer
SSL certificates and keys to all keystone nodes. Many of the openstack-ansible
repositories have refactored this behavior out in place of registering the
certificates and keys as ansible facts and using ansible's copy module to
transfer them to each node in the deployment.

This breaks the dependency of requiring memcached in order to deploy keystone
with SSL.

Change-Id: I8db39a2a4a54aa9814c1b05988f05bfcae94f222
(cherry picked from commit 7e14932dc42e1d6dc10ecbd3ce2707af0f2f7682)
"}]
commit_message:
Use ansible facts for distributing SSL certs/keys

The os_keystone role previously relied on a memcached deployment to transfer
SSL certificates and keys to all keystone nodes. Many of the openstack-ansible
repositories have refactored this behavior out in place of registering the
certificates and keys as ansible facts and using ansible's copy module to
transfer them to each node in the deployment.

This breaks the dependency of requiring memcached in order to deploy keystone
with SSL.

Change-Id: I8db39a2a4a54aa9814c1b05988f05bfcae94f222
(cherry picked from commit 7e14932dc42e1d6dc10ecbd3ce2707af0f2f7682)

subject: Fix retrieving VM notes race condition
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-13 10:56:00.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/utils/compute/vmutils.py'], 'message': 'Fix retrieving VM notes race condition

If the VM is deleted while we attempt to retrieve the VM notes, we
sometimes get a TypeError when we try to iterate over them, as the
Notes property will be set to None.

This change fixes the issue by storing this field in a different
variable, before attempting to use it.

Closes-Bug: #1569815

Change-Id: I89e73df9406a55e087751d20450e134be60867e6
'}]
commit_message:
Fix retrieving VM notes race condition

If the VM is deleted while we attempt to retrieve the VM notes, we
sometimes get a TypeError when we try to iterate over them, as the
Notes property will be set to None.

This change fixes the issue by storing this field in a different
variable, before attempting to use it.

Closes-Bug: #1569815

Change-Id: I89e73df9406a55e087751d20450e134be60867e6

commit_message:
PowerVM Virt Driver Support

The purpose of this spec is to add support for the PowerVM compute
platform to OpenStack-Ansible. This will allow the PowerVM virt
driver to be installed and configured on PowerVM compute nodes as
part of an OpenStack-Ansible deployment.

Change-Id: Ie6db6a311c104d86b8a42c73c17b9244035ee58c

commit_message:
Process deployed environment configuration in UI

Deployed environment configuration is loaded once
environment page is opened.
If deployed configuration is loaded, then
Load Deployed buttons are shown on Networks and Settings tab.
UI code checks difference between deployed settings
and current environment configuration and displays
Discard button on Dashboard.

Closes-Bug: #1564953

Change-Id: Ibd11ad8cf709fbf0ce8d09729b7bcb5507081a5c

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8003, 'name': 'Aleksandr Gordeev', 'email': 'agordeev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'agordeev'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 12:17:23.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/objects/partition/parted.py', 'fuel_agent/tests/test_partition.py', 'fuel_agent/tests/test_manager.py', 'fuel_agent/utils/partition.py', 'fuel_agent/tests/test_partition_utils.py'], 'message': "Switch from optimal alignment to minimum

fuel-agent always uses optimal alignment for partitions and
thoroughly relies on parted to perform that aligning. (-a optimal)

The issue is that under certain circumstances due to that alignment,
the end of particular partition could cross 1M boundary. And due to
actual partition' bounderies being rounded up, fuel-agent mistakenly
assumes that partition couldn't fit within provided boundaries and
raises errors.WrongPartitionSchemeError.

However, some h/w data storages are well known for reporting
relatively huge optimal IO sizes (16M or even bigger), so the 1M room
can't be enough. Thus, optimal aligning is not an option. Therefore,
parted has been switched to the minimum alignment.

The min value is the minimum aligment needed to align the partition
properly to physical blocks, which avoids performance degradation.

Change-Id: I83116ccc9236053a93664c1cf40a3ef0c1a189b7
Closes-Bug: #1543233
(cherry picked from commit 4c74eaa1875dd28d2e2c8256281d9088f83f25fb)
"}]
commit_message:
Switch from optimal alignment to minimum

fuel-agent always uses optimal alignment for partitions and
thoroughly relies on parted to perform that aligning. (-a optimal)

The issue is that under certain circumstances due to that alignment,
the end of particular partition could cross 1M boundary. And due to
actual partition' bounderies being rounded up, fuel-agent mistakenly
assumes that partition couldn't fit within provided boundaries and
raises errors.WrongPartitionSchemeError.

However, some h/w data storages are well known for reporting
relatively huge optimal IO sizes (16M or even bigger), so the 1M room
can't be enough. Thus, optimal aligning is not an option. Therefore,
parted has been switched to the minimum alignment.

The min value is the minimum aligment needed to align the partition
properly to physical blocks, which avoids performance degradation.

Change-Id: I83116ccc9236053a93664c1cf40a3ef0c1a189b7
Closes-Bug: #1543233
(cherry picked from commit 4c74eaa1875dd28d2e2c8256281d9088f83f25fb)

commit_message:
Use default value of kombu_reconnect_delay for all services

Current reconnection time is 5.0 which is pretty long.
This patch switches kombu_reconnect_delay to its default
value - 1.0 which is the same for all services.

Change-Id: Id7bac2d1988b9f91ea19edc0fe8a4bdc9958d458
Closes-bug: #1560097

'}]
commit_message:
Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Change-Id: Ic2a6031a9b098e39c95669ca6fa2b92e536dc2ad
Closes-Bug: #1552251

commit_message:
Fix unit tests failing against Puppet 4.3.0

This patch only fixes the rspec tests issues related to PUP-2315 [1] but
others issues cannot be fixed right now because we are actually facing a
Puppet 4.3.x bug [2] which will be fixed in the Puppet 4.4.x release.

[1] - https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/PUP-2315
[2] - https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/PUP-1985

Change-Id: I52c58dfda16331bff176a7af46c912022fd684fa
Related-bug: #1518871
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 80eff15738d177c3b49ecd415c2d5120687ce0be)

commit_message:

subject: Update the config_template plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-12 08:55:41.000000000', 'files': ['action/_v1_config_template.py', 'action/_v2_config_template.py'], 'message': "Update the config_template plugin

These changes address 2 issues:

* The config template plugin in v1 mode was not respecting a list
  of integers and would cause a stacktrace because the ConfigParse
  module expects everything written to be a string.
* The config template plugin in v2 mode was not properly handling
  the multi-string-op type due to an oversight in the ``_option_write``
  method.

With these updates the config template is now able to better support
all of the potential options that could be thrown at it when writing
an INI config file.

These issues we're discovered while working with the ceph-ansible
project and a mirroring PR has been created here:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/pull/707

Change-Id: I051096abae883ac81195d4538140566b69f8996c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Update the config_template plugin

These changes address 2 issues:

* The config template plugin in v1 mode was not respecting a list
  of integers and would cause a stacktrace because the ConfigParse
  module expects everything written to be a string.
* The config template plugin in v2 mode was not properly handling
  the multi-string-op type due to an oversight in the ``_option_write``
  method.

With these updates the config template is now able to better support
all of the potential options that could be thrown at it when writing
an INI config file.

These issues we're discovered while working with the ceph-ansible
project and a mirroring PR has been created here:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/pull/707

Change-Id: I051096abae883ac81195d4538140566b69f8996c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Switch to a local dns server
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-13 12:12:43.000000000', 'files': ['toci_instack.sh'], 'message': "Switch to a local dns server

We're seeing lots of failures with DNS requests in CI jobs,
it looks like the problem is happening outside of our overcloud
deployment. This is particularly bad for DNS requests presumably
because its UDP. So switch our primary DNS server to point at named
on the bastion server, while we try and find the root cause.

Change-Id: Ic59e338e4d3abee15c6d6614dd377ca81479850b
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to a local dns server

We're seeing lots of failures with DNS requests in CI jobs,
it looks like the problem is happening outside of our overcloud
deployment. This is particularly bad for DNS requests presumably
because its UDP. So switch our primary DNS server to point at named
on the bastion server, while we try and find the root cause.

Change-Id: Ic59e338e4d3abee15c6d6614dd377ca81479850b

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-12 16:21:17.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/examples/swift/tasks.yaml'], 'message': 'Run swift storage task after swift-proxy

Proxy task contains creating rings, which should be created
before any devices are added to them. But now, we have wrong
order of running these tasks: storage and devices are created
before creating rings. This error not fails our CI and deployment
on MOS packages, because they have not exit with error on pre-start
stage if some error occurred, but UCA packages have such check.

Change-Id: If4ee8adbd69e2abb80dbbf1497f31edd72e4e824
Closes-bug: #1561884
'}]
commit_message:
Run swift storage task after swift-proxy

Proxy task contains creating rings, which should be created
before any devices are added to them. But now, we have wrong
order of running these tasks: storage and devices are created
before creating rings. This error not fails our CI and deployment
on MOS packages, because they have not exit with error on pre-start
stage if some error occurred, but UCA packages have such check.

Change-Id: If4ee8adbd69e2abb80dbbf1497f31edd72e4e824
Closes-bug: #1561884

subject: Rework slave-cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-13 04:40:06.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/slave-cleanup.sh'], 'message': 'Rework slave-cleanup

The current approach does not work at all: Every job runs "git clean" as
part of set up of workspace. So, the marker we use is deleted and all
the content as well.

So, what we can do is run the "git clean" also after a run, so that the
workspace is minimal between invocations and the initial "git clean"
becomes a nop. This helps with overall space on the proposal slave
since only the active job will use .tox directories etc. Since there's
no regular cleanup of workspace, this also helps when jobs get retired,
the workspace will continue to exist - but with the cleanup done, it's
much smaller.

Change-Id: I8b17724905634aa2f7cc657de073ee7cfe10f781
'}]
commit_message:
Rework slave-cleanup

The current approach does not work at all: Every job runs "git clean" as
part of set up of workspace. So, the marker we use is deleted and all
the content as well.

So, what we can do is run the "git clean" also after a run, so that the
workspace is minimal between invocations and the initial "git clean"
becomes a nop. This helps with overall space on the proposal slave
since only the active job will use .tox directories etc. Since there's
no regular cleanup of workspace, this also helps when jobs get retired,
the workspace will continue to exist - but with the cleanup done, it's
much smaller.

Change-Id: I8b17724905634aa2f7cc657de073ee7cfe10f781

commit_message:
Rebase on parent_type/parent_uuid=>parent

Recent pypowervm commit cf1195deef19eb78ffaa85d7f7c8e6b9206770bf made it
possible to reference the parent instance for certain Wrapper methods
via a single 'parent' keyword argument where previously dual
parent_type/parent_uuid keyword arguments were required.  This change
set takes advantage of the new syntax.

Change-Id: If29fef89d2dc6225a9a457b91885ace5216b9dc5

commit_message:
More friendly message reinstalling a v1.0 plugin.

Now the code is showing a more friendly message to the user,
instead of the full resp response.

[root@fuel objects]# fuel plugins --install /tmp/lbaas-1.0.0.fp
DEPRECATION WARNING: The plugin has old 1.0 package format, this
format does not support many features, such as plugins updates,
find plugin in new format or migrate and rebuild this one.
Nothing to do: LBaaS plugin for Neutron, version 1.0.0, does not
update installed plugin.

Change-Id: I865c1024bde851bf4873aff4f775b8aac5329d35
Closes-Bug: 1396154

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-07 07:54:00.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/tests/unit/test_shell.py'], 'message': 'Fix logging issue in heatclient tests

For now heatclient unittests are showing some traceback
due to an issue in logging handler:
http://goo.gl/myPV87
The main point of this patch is to get rid of these
tracebacks. Some explanation:
- tracebacks were caused by logwarnings in some tests
trying to write to closed stream
- test_shell contain this shell_error method
which uses some magic with replacing sys.stderr with
six.StringIO(), calling shell.main which (among other things)
configures logging and then returning sys.stderr to previous
state and closing six.StringIO()
- but logger is still containing closed stream as
logging handler
- other tests do not configure logging so handler
remains the same
- with this replacing thing shell_error can return
sys.stderr.getvalue() but this return is never used in test now

So i think its safe to remove replacing magic.

Closes-Bug: #1567262
Change-Id: If4d1b3fb2c809b1d5d9e70ad63cf05c5ff0797ed
'}]
commit_message:
Fix logging issue in heatclient tests

For now heatclient unittests are showing some traceback
due to an issue in logging handler:
http://goo.gl/myPV87
The main point of this patch is to get rid of these
tracebacks. Some explanation:
- tracebacks were caused by logwarnings in some tests
trying to write to closed stream
- test_shell contain this shell_error method
which uses some magic with replacing sys.stderr with
six.StringIO(), calling shell.main which (among other things)
configures logging and then returning sys.stderr to previous
state and closing six.StringIO()
- but logger is still containing closed stream as
logging handler
- other tests do not configure logging so handler
remains the same
- with this replacing thing shell_error can return
sys.stderr.getvalue() but this return is never used in test now

So i think its safe to remove replacing magic.

Closes-Bug: #1567262
Change-Id: If4d1b3fb2c809b1d5d9e70ad63cf05c5ff0797ed

commit_message:
Add macvtap agent as group to config reference

Macvtap configuration options got grouped together with lb config
options. This fix introduces a separate config group for macvtap
agent.

Change-Id: I92e66510eace0bc02e535e1fbb0a605f2eafdacb
Closes-Bug: #1567804

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-21 12:23:06.000000000', 'files': ['guidelines/headers.rst'], 'message': 'Avoid redundancy in header values

If the name of a header explains what the value is (by virtue of the
name) there is no need to explain again in the value of the header.

Change-Id: I4f52b403b3f514e2ca3609775b54aa2bcf5a2af2
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid redundancy in header values

If the name of a header explains what the value is (by virtue of the
name) there is no need to explain again in the value of the header.

Change-Id: I4f52b403b3f514e2ca3609775b54aa2bcf5a2af2

commit_message:
Add EndpointMap as output

The endpoint map contains, not only the hosts and protocols that
the resulting services will use, but also the ports. This
information is useful, and the aim of this patch is to make it
available for the tripleoclient to use it.

Change-Id: I4cc5bbf2e7200f78cd90b93659c326a9200278d7
Bug: #1569851
(cherry picked from commit 321cee7616186e83e9a5eff9e9a9abe9b9f82fab)

commit_message:
Upgraded eslint and resolved new errors

Upgraded eslint from 1.2.1 August 2015 to latest 1.x version, 1.10.3,
fixing many issues and checks not working correctly or missing
completely: http://eslint.org/docs/rules/operator-linebreak.html.

Resolved newly detected errors. Currently reports many warnings that
can now be surpressed with new config flag "--max-warnings" if desired.

Change-Id: If64e361a3a49ce33156c7558def4867651104d76
Closes-Bug: #1547406

subject: Protection manager register protectable plugins
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-10 08:37:36.000000000', 'files': ['smaug/services/protection/manager.py', 'smaug/services/protection/protectable_registry.py', 'smaug/tests/unit/protection/test_manager.py', 'smaug/tests/unit/protection/test_protectable.py'], 'message': 'Protection manager register protectable plugins

ProtectableRegistry plugin_map now belongs to the instance and not
the class. As a result, all ProtectableRegistry methods are now not
classmethods, and passing the context now happens through methods
and not the constructor.

Protection manager creates a single ProtectableRegistry and loads its
plugins, instead of creating a ProtectableRegistry for every method
requiring context for its operation.

Change-Id: I64120fe949b2fd936561a13822ca8bae616d4fa8
'}]
commit_message:
Protection manager register protectable plugins

ProtectableRegistry plugin_map now belongs to the instance and not
the class. As a result, all ProtectableRegistry methods are now not
classmethods, and passing the context now happens through methods
and not the constructor.

Protection manager creates a single ProtectableRegistry and loads its
plugins, instead of creating a ProtectableRegistry for every method
requiring context for its operation.

Change-Id: I64120fe949b2fd936561a13822ca8bae616d4fa8

Closes-Bug: #1561048
"}]
commit_message:
[zmq] Fix cast message loss in simulator

In this change rely on eventlet socket locks and
don't use queue to sync green threads access to socket.

Change-Id: I1c712ecc1ac4ec995e2b7652866a8b2d691543ce
Closes-Bug: #1561048

subject: Don't use bash eval for Linux.runCommand
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-06 13:12:55.000000000', 'files': ['meta/io.murano/Resources/scripts/runCommand.sh', 'murano/engine/system/agent.py', 'meta/io.murano/Resources/RunCommand.template'], 'message': 'Don't use bash eval for Linux.runCommand

Linux.runCommand method used to pass script
in a command line argument and evaluated it using
"eval". This approach failed when the script contained
input redirection.

With this fix script is passed as a file which is specified
as an entry point in execution plan.
Also we supported explicit files in execution plan but not
for the script entry point. This was fixed as well.

Change-Id: Ifd15fc57b08e33ed61cd2765613cd705ce12a5f2
Closes-Bug: #1562954
'}]
commit_message:
Don't use bash eval for Linux.runCommand

Linux.runCommand method used to pass script
in a command line argument and evaluated it using
"eval". This approach failed when the script contained
input redirection.

With this fix script is passed as a file which is specified
as an entry point in execution plan.
Also we supported explicit files in execution plan but not
for the script entry point. This was fixed as well.

Change-Id: Ifd15fc57b08e33ed61cd2765613cd705ce12a5f2
Closes-Bug: #1562954

subject: Fix incorrect ICMP rule in SecurityGroup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-06 13:02:06.000000000', 'files': ['meta/io.murano/Classes/system/NeutronSecurityGroupManager.yaml'], 'message': "Fix incorrect ICMP rule in SecurityGroup

When protocol is ICMP in security group, port_range_min and
port_range_max are used to indicate type and code for ICMP. The
default port setting in core library generates ICMP rule with
incorrect setting 'icmptype 0 code 0', which make user cannot ping
instance created by Murano environment. So removed them.

Change-Id: I93b5073db2ece804e3eccdde8432216d4fb12301
Closes-Bug: #1512710
(cherry picked from commit 47b406d603821f12f8b4bf49d37969ad08aa4ead)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect ICMP rule in SecurityGroup

When protocol is ICMP in security group, port_range_min and
port_range_max are used to indicate type and code for ICMP. The
default port setting in core library generates ICMP rule with
incorrect setting 'icmptype 0 code 0', which make user cannot ping
instance created by Murano environment. So removed them.

Change-Id: I93b5073db2ece804e3eccdde8432216d4fb12301
Closes-Bug: #1512710
(cherry picked from commit 47b406d603821f12f8b4bf49d37969ad08aa4ead)

subject: Use network space binding for shared-db relation
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-13 10:34:12.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_keystone_hooks.py', 'hooks/keystone_hooks.py', 'README.md'], 'message': "Use network space binding for shared-db relation

To ensure that the charm presents the right IP address for
accessing the MySQL database over the shared-db relation,
ensure that any network space binding provided by the user
is preferred over the default of 'private-address'.

If network spaces is not supported (juju < 2.0), fallback to
using 'private-address'.

Change-Id: Ic2ed5d2cb88084c8eab33326bc16eb700ae9a35f
"}]
commit_message:
Use network space binding for shared-db relation

To ensure that the charm presents the right IP address for
accessing the MySQL database over the shared-db relation,
ensure that any network space binding provided by the user
is preferred over the default of 'private-address'.

If network spaces is not supported (juju < 2.0), fallback to
using 'private-address'.

Change-Id: Ic2ed5d2cb88084c8eab33326bc16eb700ae9a35f

Upstream modules are switching to use oslo
resources. Oslo module configures non-deprecated
parameter "oslo_messaging_notifications/driver"
and "oslo_messaging_notifications/topics"
To prevent noop-test failures these tests are
commented out. Also this patch overrides

Change-Id: I6b27f883d5eb07d3876e90e52a0880c5feb28054

commit_message:
Disable tests for deprecated notification* parameters

Upstream modules are switching to use oslo
resources. Oslo module configures non-deprecated
parameter "oslo_messaging_notifications/driver"
and "oslo_messaging_notifications/topics"
To prevent noop-test failures these tests are
commented out. Also this patch overrides
old parameters to check with non-deprecated
"oslo_messaging_notifications" section.

Closes-bug: #1568796

Change-Id: I6b27f883d5eb07d3876e90e52a0880c5feb28054

Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Change-Id: I992f38ba935536c59217e22d4071f40a69090fc2
Closes-Bug: #1552251

commit_message:
Switch to auto-generated cron trigger names in unit tests

* Before this change there was a possibility of conflicts between
  different tests working with cron triggers, especially if run
  in parallel, because of using same trigger names (e.g. 'test').
  To prevent such potential situations all trigger names should
  be unique and generated randomly.

Change-Id: I57b0ac8072ab5f9158547fa0611a1003d1dc5e8a
Partial-Bug: #1564353

commit_message:
Also package mistral_tempest_tests

With the current setup.cfg, the folder mistral_tempest_tests is not
being packaged, making it more difficult for package maintainer like
myself to run tempest tests. Please allow this change, so that I don't
have to carry such a patch in the Debian package.

Change-Id: I5c34f3516c4f171ab4f34647f1cc4a08883feacf
(cherry picked from commit a4c4eadbcea65697af129f8f54d7bdb2e45c1397)

subject: Blacklist broken Babel releases
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-13 07:48:38.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Blacklist broken Babel releases

Babel 2.3.2 failed to parse horizon.
Babel 2.3.3 fixes this but breaks all python projects, the log-level log
files contain far too much content ;(

From https://github.com/python-babel/babel/issues/388:
* versions 2.3.0..2.3.2 break multiple -k/--keywords arguments for
  pybabel extract
* version 2.3.3 breaks the single -k/--keywords argument accepted by
  distutils extract_messages

Blacklist all these versions, and downgrade constraints.

Change-Id: Ia61e96963c0c81814d89c247c82fd75c6ab86a81
'}]
commit_message:
Blacklist broken Babel releases

Babel 2.3.2 failed to parse horizon.
Babel 2.3.3 fixes this but breaks all python projects, the log-level log
files contain far too much content ;(

From https://github.com/python-babel/babel/issues/388:
* versions 2.3.0..2.3.2 break multiple -k/--keywords arguments for
  pybabel extract
* version 2.3.3 breaks the single -k/--keywords argument accepted by
  distutils extract_messages

Blacklist all these versions, and downgrade constraints.

Change-Id: Ia61e96963c0c81814d89c247c82fd75c6ab86a81

subject: Add openstack/monasca-transform project
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-04 19:59:57.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'Add openstack/monasca-transform project

The monasca-transform project is a new component in Monasca that
will aggregate and transform metrics. For example, it will consume
metrics for Swift from the Monasca metrics topic and count the total
number of times a container or object is accessed and group them by
project. Then it will publish the aggregated metric to the Kafka
metrics topic where the rest of the existing Monasca components
will be used to store, alarm and notify.

Change-Id: I9227a6afb468e05aaeb939930b872d1c64f79551
Depends-On: I7826768e174a229bc184ea38d75d212ac957e26c
'}]
commit_message:
Add openstack/monasca-transform project

The monasca-transform project is a new component in Monasca that
will aggregate and transform metrics. For example, it will consume
metrics for Swift from the Monasca metrics topic and count the total
number of times a container or object is accessed and group them by
project. Then it will publish the aggregated metric to the Kafka
metrics topic where the rest of the existing Monasca components
will be used to store, alarm and notify.

Change-Id: I9227a6afb468e05aaeb939930b872d1c64f79551
Depends-On: I7826768e174a229bc184ea38d75d212ac957e26c

commit_message:
Mark Sahara as follows deprecation policy

Sahara follows this deprecation policy in API,
config options and features. Regarding enabled by default
vendor plugins we follows rule 4 as well. This commit
will entry point to follow this policy offically.

In Newton design sessions we will have meetup where more
strict rules (based at this tag, for sure)
will be defined and posted in sahara documentation.

Change-Id: Ib19f2129f9b070ceb0fd53b3215168e4e36f92cd

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-12-26 03:21:24.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/common/driver_factory.py', 'ironic/conductor/rpcapi.py'], 'message': 'ironic-api vaild the input driver

If user run node-create with a driver which is not enabled and

When the driver failed to load ironic-conductor warning log
records.

commit_message:
ironic-api vaild the input driver

If user run node-create with a driver which is not enabled and
activated, we will get below message:
"No valid host was found. Reason: No conductor service
registered which supports driver xxxxxxxxx. (HTTP 400)"

When the driver failed to load ironic-conductor warning log
records.

if input driver is not enabled ,we get below message:
"No valid driver was found. Reason: No conductor service registered
 which enables driver xxx. This could be because no host enable the
 driver with the option enabled_drivers in ironic.conf. (HTTP 400)"

Change-Id: I77b8f409d15d6b09cf171ee482f912223a589f9d
Closes-Bug: #1398286

subject: Inherit from correct class for WSGI server
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-05 07:19:22.000000000', 'files': ['ec2api/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Inherit from correct class for WSGI server

Using oslo.service requires the WSGI server class to implement
oslo_service.service.ServiceBase. ec2api.wsgi.Server already implemented
the interface thus defined but lacked the correct parent class.

Change-Id: Iecd2721830821ef75a321fa800d2bbd85b3ce1e1
Closes-Bug: #1562860
'}]
commit_message:
Inherit from correct class for WSGI server

Using oslo.service requires the WSGI server class to implement
oslo_service.service.ServiceBase. ec2api.wsgi.Server already implemented
the interface thus defined but lacked the correct parent class.

Change-Id: Iecd2721830821ef75a321fa800d2bbd85b3ce1e1
Closes-Bug: #1562860

subject: Ensure that PK values don't default to NULL
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-08 12:21:06.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/liberty/contract/56893333aa52_fix_identifier_map_fk.py'], 'message': "Ensure that PK values don't default to NULL

MySQL 5.7 is stricter by default; ensure that the primary key
of cisco_csr_identifier_map does not end up with NULL default
otherwise the migration step will fail with:

 'All parts of a PRIMARY KEY must be NOT NULL; if you need NULL in a key, use UNIQUE instead'

Behavioural change introduced in 5.7.3:

 http://dev.mysql.com/doc/relnotes/mysql/5.7/en/news-5-7-3.html

Change-Id: Iad2033bec39d223556c2605e3ba3f3dab44223a1
Closes-Bug: #1567899
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that PK values don't default to NULL

MySQL 5.7 is stricter by default; ensure that the primary key
of cisco_csr_identifier_map does not end up with NULL default
otherwise the migration step will fail with:

 'All parts of a PRIMARY KEY must be NOT NULL; if you need NULL in a key, use UNIQUE instead'

Behavioural change introduced in 5.7.3:

 http://dev.mysql.com/doc/relnotes/mysql/5.7/en/news-5-7-3.html

Change-Id: Iad2033bec39d223556c2605e3ba3f3dab44223a1
Closes-Bug: #1567899

commit_message:
Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Closes-Bug: #1552251

commit_message:
updated Ironic role to fix tftp-hpa issues

This change addresses two issues:

1 - the tftpd-hpa package has to be installed on all conductors
    regardless of standalone more or not.
2 - the tftpd-hpa has an issue where is till not function over
    ipv4 unless expressly set. To resolve this issue the default
    configuration file has been changed to lockdown the listen
    address and set the port. This is the related launchpad issue
    for tftp-hpa [0]

[0] - https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/tftp-hpa/+bug/1448500

Change-Id: I9861de0a0384661a27f0971f77ab340f4c1d59e3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Fix pip issue on the gate
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-22 10:41:09.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Fix pip issue on the gate

"Detected a distutils installed project" issue is hitting for argparse.

As a workaround, making pbr version > 1.0 so that venv having pip < 8
and works fine. pbr < 1.0 endup with pip 8 and fails. pbr < 1.0 has
pip explicitly in requirement.txt and trigger to update the pip to 8.
pbr > 1.0 does not have the requirement.txt thing and does not trigger
pip updates for venv.

The change is already added to global-requirements.

Change-Id: I13e379759443192facbb626cda3fa640aab5be1f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pip issue on the gate

"Detected a distutils installed project" issue is hitting for argparse.

As a workaround, making pbr version > 1.0 so that venv having pip < 8
and works fine. pbr < 1.0 endup with pip 8 and fails. pbr < 1.0 has
pip explicitly in requirement.txt and trigger to update the pip to 8.
pbr > 1.0 does not have the requirement.txt thing and does not trigger
pip updates for venv.

The change is already added to global-requirements.

Change-Id: I13e379759443192facbb626cda3fa640aab5be1f

commit_message:
Update ironic.conf for swift and keystone compat

This change makes is intended to simplify the the ironic.conf file
so that we only carry what is needed. In the file we're setting the
swift configuration section when not in stand alone mode and the
keystone_auth section has been updated for the options that ironic
requires.

URI testing for ironic's rest API has been updated to run the tests
using a header for the authentication token. This is required now that
the keystone_auth section is filled in.

Co-Authored-By: Michael Davies <michael@the-davies.net>
Change-Id: Ic6bd466e6fa03c2382424666588c306bad473e99
Partially-implements: blueprint role-ironic
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:

When enable force_metadata in dhcp.ini, and create a network

commit_message:
Add 169.254.169.254 when enable force_metadata

When enable force_metadata in dhcp.ini, and create a network
and a subnet, none 169.254.169.254/24 ip info set in related
namespace(qdhcp-XXX) with `ip a` command. In this case, vms could
not get metadata any more.

Change-Id: Ib5b95f3afc6e66f66cdb7e1e98e5450a6e80a1b2
Closes-Bug: #1549793
(cherry picked from commit 45bec12cfc27578597cd197334979d0aee73a2cf)

commit_message:
Fix the purge_config option for api and registry

It appears that the resources decleration, that made purge_config work,
was accidently removed. I am adding it back so that the option will work
again. This resources decleration was setting the purge flag with a
boolean, so that inifile would handle it.
  * Adding in spec tests

Change-Id: Ib80b89932c60aeab0d252109d2e79ac0f209596b

commit_message:
[install] move OS_IMAGE_API_VERSION variable into "Create OpenStack client environment scripts"

the OpenStack client environment scripts after the installation of the
image service

commit_message:
Print proper status in task results

If there are no results for task, `rally task results` prints message that
task is in failed status, but it can be not true(tasks in running state do
not have results).

Change-Id: I66b606bd89bdad0478cce35d8d68a736bc6eb34d
Closes-Bug: #1539096

commit_message:
Manage the pipeline to remove keystone auth

puppet-gnocchi cannot run keystoneless setup since it doesn't manage
the pipeline configuration parameter.

These modifications removes the keystone authentication if it is
necessary.

- Fix rally task verification log for FAILED tasks.
- Fix inconsistent output of "rally task detailed"
  for non-FINISHED / non-FAILED tasks.
- Fix unit tests for rally.cli.commands.task

Change-Id: I97787b211aca0872251fab3b80cc213338ac2657

commit_message:
delete verbose/redundant/deprecated text

the docs are a bit wordy in some places. our docs are confusing
enough:

- remove notification > polling in architecture page
- remove redundant Events filtering from event_types
- move shuffle/batch options to customisation page
- add http publisher
- remove db choices from architecture page, point to dbreco page
- remove db background referencing single database route
- remove warnings to say db might change, use api (obvious)
- remove stuff about Ceilometer is part Openstack but not tied to it
- move hbase configuration under common hbase section in install
- remove tox compatibility comments since it's > 2 years
- remove random non-devstack/historical text from devstack page
- remove default cinder/nova configurations from devstack page

Change-Id: Ifdbeee358cfcb5d3736608e39067ff2859cc0ed6

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-11 00:29:23.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/ceph/manifests/mon.pp'], 'message': 'Fix unless condition for ceph-deploy

In case of using an array parameter in Exec {unless}, it will run only if all

commit_message:
Fix unless condition for ceph-deploy

In case of using an array parameter in Exec {unless}, it will run only if all
commands are false. However, we need to execute it if any of conditional
commands is false.

Change-Id: I002c734ffdbd6e6f69ff83c5f98e503e09503356
Closes-bug: #1565703

Part of the effort to encourage the v3 identity v3 API usage, it runs
the non-voting identity v3 only job against cinder to ensure it can work
without the keystone v2 api.

subject: vif_plug_ovs: merge both plugins into one
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-04 16:58:44.000000000', 'files': ['vif_plug_ovs/ovs.py', 'vif_plug_ovs/ovs_hybrid.py', 'setup.cfg', 'vif_plug_ovs/tests/test_plugin.py'], 'message': "vif_plug_ovs: merge both plugins into one

There is no need to create separate plugins for each type of
VIF configuration - a single plugin is intended to be capable
of supporting multiple different VIF configs. On this basis,
the ovs & ovs_hybrid plugins can be merged to just create a
single 'ovs' plugin. This means that consumers of os-vif do
not need to remember multiple different plugin names - they
can always just use the 'ovs' plugin and feed it whichever
type of VIF config they desire.

Change-Id: I8ab37fea065a3d92585decf89bcc095c404e6ed2
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
vif_plug_ovs: merge both plugins into one

There is no need to create separate plugins for each type of
VIF configuration - a single plugin is intended to be capable
of supporting multiple different VIF configs. On this basis,
the ovs & ovs_hybrid plugins can be merged to just create a
single 'ovs' plugin. This means that consumers of os-vif do
not need to remember multiple different plugin names - they
can always just use the 'ovs' plugin and feed it whichever
type of VIF config they desire.

Change-Id: I8ab37fea065a3d92585decf89bcc095c404e6ed2
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Compute: remove the 'method' variable from InstanceInvalidState

Commit 8b54c4a0612b7f222055180decba74ed14367476 used the incorrect
method name when raising an exception.

The internal method should not be passed to the end user. This patch
drops the 'method' variable.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ic2152b9e47f6fe90915685e8e13e03969f025c5a

subject: Add tempest variations of Designate DSVM jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-12 15:36:57.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/designate.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Add tempest variations of Designate DSVM jobs

* Adds two new experimental jobs (Designate+Bind9/PowerDNS)
* Does not restrict execution branch yet, we'll want this to
  be Neuton+ as it moves over the check/gate queues. For now,
  i'd like to see just how badly the remaining changes below
  fail on other branches, as we may choose to include these
  on Mitaka.
* Replaces use of the gate / pre test / post tests hooks, as
  enough configurability is now exposed.
* Uses tempest in "all-plugin" mode, limiting to all tests
  containing "designate" in the name. Ideally, this would be
  changed to "full-plugin" mode, without the designate
  restriction, but this does not exist in tempest's tox.ini
* Attempts to be ready to add stable branch editions of this
  this using branch-override and job-suffix.

Change-Id: I8166d447802b4520c0721b9f006b59543b3b548c
'}]
commit_message:
Add tempest variations of Designate DSVM jobs

* Adds two new experimental jobs (Designate+Bind9/PowerDNS)
* Does not restrict execution branch yet, we'll want this to
  be Neuton+ as it moves over the check/gate queues. For now,
  i'd like to see just how badly the remaining changes below
  fail on other branches, as we may choose to include these
  on Mitaka.
* Replaces use of the gate / pre test / post tests hooks, as
  enough configurability is now exposed.
* Uses tempest in "all-plugin" mode, limiting to all tests
  containing "designate" in the name. Ideally, this would be
  changed to "full-plugin" mode, without the designate
  restriction, but this does not exist in tempest's tox.ini
* Attempts to be ready to add stable branch editions of this
  this using branch-override and job-suffix.

Change-Id: I8166d447802b4520c0721b9f006b59543b3b548c

subject: crypto: use cipher required iv length for random iv
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-13 07:29:08.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/crypto.py'], 'message': 'crypto: use cipher required iv length for random iv

This is simply replacing the value 8 with the required
iv length derived from the AES cipher class so the
random iv length should remain correct if the cipher
were ever to change, and to make code consistent with
the derived iv case.

Unit tests already cover this.

Change-Id: I402f4d97bc9d8e5c42f516084725749bed263d09
'}]
commit_message:
crypto: use cipher required iv length for random iv

This is simply replacing the value 8 with the required
iv length derived from the AES cipher class so the
random iv length should remain correct if the cipher
were ever to change, and to make code consistent with
the derived iv case.

Unit tests already cover this.

Change-Id: I402f4d97bc9d8e5c42f516084725749bed263d09

commit_message:
Conditional GETs Fix

This patch enables the conditional GETs feature (if_match,
if_none_match) to be used with encryption.

Also changes decrypter to attempt to decrypt response headers
for all response status codes, not just 2xx, so that we get
decrypted etags in 412 responses etc.

Change-Id: I01564734a915bb4334cfc3eb8ad363aabbbcdd93

Commit 77de9653fd60a802b11f157972f7b3e81497e8a7 added a RetryRequest
exception to the policy engine for when items disappeared during policy
enforcement lookups. However, the API was not catching them for the
show and list operations.

This patch adds the decorators to the two methods to catch any
retry exception that may be emitted from the policy engine or
wherever else.

          neutron.db.api so this uses oslo_db_api directly.

commit_message:
Protect 'show' and 'index' with Retry decorator

Commit 77de9653fd60a802b11f157972f7b3e81497e8a7 added a RetryRequest
exception to the policy engine for when items disappeared during policy
enforcement lookups. However, the API was not catching them for the
show and list operations.

This patch adds the decorators to the two methods to catch any
retry exception that may be emitted from the policy engine or
wherever else.

CONFLICT: The custom neutron decorator had not been added yet in
          neutron.db.api so this uses oslo_db_api directly.

Closes-Bug: #1528031
Change-Id: If4aea5245cdbb2ea545e9a96d73386e3c21a3696
(cherry-picked from 2a27361cf50259281924dbdaba3f06367ef327e7)

commit_message:
Use network space binding for shared-db relation

To ensure that the charm presents the right IP address for
accessing the MySQL database over the shared-db relation,
ensure that any network space binding provided by the user
is preferred over the default of 'private-address'.

If network spaces is not supported (juju < 2.0), fallback to
using 'private-address'.

Change-Id: If91dd8e9a4f47c5455095532ed27433eaf0d47d4

commit_message:
Enable functional convergence testing

This change adds variables and tasks for enabling developer mode to
allow for installing barbican without a repo server, moves the tasks
creating the barbican rabbit virtual host and mysql database from the
role to a playbook, and adds functional convergence test playbooks to
deploy rabbitmq, galera, keystone, and barbican.

The barbican.conf template has been updated to make use of the deployed
rabbit and galera servers and all other templated configuration files
have been updated from the current head of master.

Change-Id: I2716fbe6a5dbad2a3b7ce6e406098e463cf7d943

commit_message:
Remove Disable HAProxy option from Quick Start Guide

The disable HAProxy option is not commonly used and not
recommended.  This patch moves the section that describes it
out of the Quick Start Guide and into the Advanced Configuration
Guide.

Change-Id: Iccd8a6369d772bd85f304cba0a99300180a369c8
Closes-Bug: #1569560

subject: Disable translations completely
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-13 08:36:20.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/propose_translation_update.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/upstream_translation_update.sh'], 'message': 'Disable translations completely

Babel 2.3.3 has broken all python projects. I expect that with the way
Zanata works, we will get back all strings but right now all log-level
strings are extracted in the wrong way.

Temporarily disable translations completely. We do not loose any data
due to this and win time to discuss a proper plan.

Change-Id: Iae8d6b32736b1dd9cff3142c00a27399e4862304
'}]
commit_message:
Disable translations completely

Babel 2.3.3 has broken all python projects. I expect that with the way
Zanata works, we will get back all strings but right now all log-level
strings are extracted in the wrong way.

Temporarily disable translations completely. We do not loose any data
due to this and win time to discuss a proper plan.

Change-Id: Iae8d6b32736b1dd9cff3142c00a27399e4862304

subject: Fix handlers
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-09 21:41:48.000000000', 'files': ['handlers/main.yml'], 'message': "Fix handlers

The handler to restart mysql is using an incorrect registered variable
to check if the restart succeeded, leading to multiple service restarts
each time its notified.

The 'Remove stale .sst' and 'Restart mysql fall back' handlers will only
be notified if 'Restart mysql' is 'changed', but their when clauses
were checking for 'failed'. Regardless, their when clauses can be
removed.

Change-Id: Icc038d17b560b24bb9bf5fdd523835102ca97030
"}]
commit_message:
Fix handlers

The handler to restart mysql is using an incorrect registered variable
to check if the restart succeeded, leading to multiple service restarts
each time its notified.

The 'Remove stale .sst' and 'Restart mysql fall back' handlers will only
be notified if 'Restart mysql' is 'changed', but their when clauses
were checking for 'failed'. Regardless, their when clauses can be
removed.

Change-Id: Icc038d17b560b24bb9bf5fdd523835102ca97030

subject: Only confirm token binding on one token
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 05:39:04.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/auth_token/test_auth_token_middleware.py', 'keystonemiddleware/auth_token/__init__.py', 'keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/client_fixtures.py'], 'message': "Only confirm token binding on one token

When using service tokens and kerberos, the REMOTE_USER will be the
service user, and hence the token bind confirmation will always fail to
validate the client user's token, making it impossible to use token
binding with service tokens. This patch adds a test to expose the issue
and fixes the problem by only validating the token binding for the
service token when both tokens are in the request.

Change-Id: I7ba2283e8e58b89f1e42bc738c7e77284321e3a5
Closes-bug: #1413433
"}]
commit_message:
Only confirm token binding on one token

When using service tokens and kerberos, the REMOTE_USER will be the
service user, and hence the token bind confirmation will always fail to
validate the client user's token, making it impossible to use token
binding with service tokens. This patch adds a test to expose the issue
and fixes the problem by only validating the token binding for the
service token when both tokens are in the request.

Change-Id: I7ba2283e8e58b89f1e42bc738c7e77284321e3a5
Closes-bug: #1413433

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-03-30 09:55:41.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/opts.py', 'gnocchi/storage/kairosdb.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': "Gnocchi driver for KairosDB with Cassandra

The driver allows to:
* create metrics
* add raw and pre-aggregated measures
* get raw or preaggregated measures
* delete measures
* delete metrics

There is a write delay in KairosDB which default value is
equal to 1000 milliseconds. To change write delay value in
KairosDB, change this line:
'kairosdb.datastore.cassandra.write_delay=1000'
in conf/kairosdb.properties file.

Change-Id: Ifa326022dc94b26711bab28d840be034a4dc0a2a
"}]
commit_message:
Gnocchi driver for KairosDB with Cassandra

The driver allows to:
* create metrics
* add raw and pre-aggregated measures
* get raw or preaggregated measures
* delete measures
* delete metrics

There is a write delay in KairosDB which default value is
equal to 1000 milliseconds. To change write delay value in
KairosDB, change this line:
'kairosdb.datastore.cassandra.write_delay=1000'
in conf/kairosdb.properties file.

Change-Id: Ifa326022dc94b26711bab28d840be034a4dc0a2a

subject: replace fnmatch with oslo.utils.fnmatch
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-11 14:28:18.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/pipeline.py', 'ceilometer/meter/notifications.py', 'ceilometer/event/converter.py', 'ceilometer/agent/manager.py', 'ceilometer/dispatcher/gnocchi.py', 'ceilometer/utils.py'], 'message': 'replace fnmatch with oslo.utils.fnmatch

oslo.utils has implemented a thread safe fnmatch, we can use it
instead of maintaining a private one.

Change-Id: Idb8a3d9f2b0fb16ec403f2da3ad00ee0d982454e
'}]
commit_message:
replace fnmatch with oslo.utils.fnmatch

oslo.utils has implemented a thread safe fnmatch, we can use it
instead of maintaining a private one.

Change-Id: Idb8a3d9f2b0fb16ec403f2da3ad00ee0d982454e

commit_message:
Add oslo for puppet testing dependencies

This change adds oslo to the fixtures for the ceph, cluster, openstack,
osnailyfacter and vmware modules. The oslo module is being used by the
upstream puppet openstack modules to centralize the oslo configuration
items so we need to pull it in for our rspec tests.

Change-Id: Ia12fc7555d142626606bade86a6e3387eedf9c6e
Closes-Bug: #1569534

commit_message:
Add keystone service ID to observer audit

Information of the observer in the CADF notification was  only two of
the "typeURI" and "id".
So, add the ID of the identity service as a "identity_id".

Change-Id: I579ad3051f784a6411f6f7af636c2c91d75c7425
Closes-Bug: #1428946

commit_message:
group federated identity docs together

several of the federated identity docs were spread out in hard
to find locations. this puts the documentation more front and
centrer. expect detailed changes for each docs in future patches.

Change-Id: I82ba117dfd02f921d72b9f010becad57da03e090
